WHAT IS EARL GREY TEA MADE FROM
 A tea is flavored or scented during 1) _______(manufacture) toward the end of the processing, usually once the tea leaves 2) _______(dry). One way teas are flavoured is by 3) ________(blend) the finished tea with flowers, herbs and spices so that the blended ingredients are visually appealing and lightly infuse the tea 4) ________(leaf) with their aroma and flavour. Another way tea is flavored is by spraying the finished tea with extracts, essential oils or flavoring agents during or after the drying process. This adds much a much 5) ________(strong) flavor to the tea and uses 6) ________(few) ingredients. The flavoring-to-tea ratio is completely up to the tea manufacturer, and the flavours that come 7) _______(через) to a brewed cup of flavored tea will vary by brand. Earl Grey is most 8) ________(wide) defined as a black tea that 9) _______(flavour) with the oil of bergamot. There is no one way to make Earl Grey tea, 10) ________(однако), which is why every Earl Grey tea you ever 11) _______(try) has probably tasted slightly different. 
 
 WHAT DOES EARL GREY TEA TASTE LIKE 
   In its purest form without any sugar, milk, lemon, or any other 12) ________(add), the Earl Grey tea taste leans heavily towards floral with an unmistakably aromatic scent.  Earl Grey’s bold flavor stems from the 13) _______(combine) of bergamot essential oil and black tea blends, offering you a unique taste: pleasantly bitter. When thinking about your tea choice, “pleasantly bitter” may not jump to the front of your mind, though you’ll likely find the citrusy kick and 14) _____(reason) caffeine content just what you need to power through your day. This 15) ________(отчетливый) flavor can be polarizing, leading some to strongly dislike the fan-favorite. However, Twinings, the popular tea brand that claims it invented Earl Grey tea, states that this is their top selling tea type around the world.

HOW MILK OOLONG IS MADE 
   In order to reach the partial 1) _______(oxidize) stage, tea makers twist and bruise the leaves. The colour changes to either a brown or green as the 2) _____(листья) cell walls break down and oxidize. To stop the 3) ____(oxidize) process, the leaves go through 4) _____(heat). This process happens several times until the 5) _____(желаемый) flavour notes exist in the leaves. The leaves grow on mountains and the 6) ______(elevate) plays a major role in the tea. The higher the 6) ______(elevate), the more flavours, and aromas become intensely 7) ______(concentrate) in the tea leaves. If you want the highest quality Milk Oolong tea, it needs to grow on a large mountain for that rich taste and scent. 
 
 HOW YO BREW MILK OOLONG 
   To prepare Milk Oolong, we recommend you to use a 8) ______(чайник), tea infuser, or tea filter. These 9) ______(brew) methods give the tea leaves 10) ______(достаточно) room 11) ______(expand) as the tea steeps, resulting in a richer, more 12) ______(flavour) cup. This is especially important when it comes to oolong teas, since the tightly rolled tea leaves can expand to many times their original size as the tea steeps. You should use 13) ______(примерно) one teaspoon of tea leaves for every six ounces of water in your pot or cup. Heat water until it 14) ______(steam) but not boiling and 15) _______(reach) a temperature of about 195 degrees. Infuse your tea for two to three minutes, then enjoy!

HOW TO BREW PU-ERH TEA 
   To prepare pu-erh teas using a Western 1)______(prepare) method, you 2)______(should; must; need; have to) use 3)______(примерно) one teaspoon of tea leaves for every six ounces of water. Heat water until it 4)______(reach) a full boil, then infuse the tea leaves for one to five minutes. Pu-erh prepared in this way can also be steeped multiple times. Pu-erh is often prepared in a yixing pot or gaiwan using the 5)______(tradition) Chinese Gong Fu Cha method. With this method, you infuse the tea leaves for only a few seconds, then pour your tea into the small 6)______(чашки).  Repeat this process, infusing the tea leaves for 10-15 seconds at a time before 7)______(pour) the tea. Later 8)______(infuse) steeping for several minutes. Pu-erh teas prepared in this way can be infused 9)_______(many; much; a lot of) times, with 10)______(каждый) successive steeping producing a mellower flavor and exposing different nuances in the tea. 
 
 WHAT IS TASTE OF PU-ERH LIKE 
   Conducting a tea tasting is another great way to immerse yourself in the flavor of this unique type of tea. The taste of pu-erh is highly 11)______(depend) how long the tea 12)______(age), and changes during storage. A 13)______(качественный) drink has a deep, rich taste, in which sweetness, bitterness and "earthiness" are felt. In some varieties, notes of 14)______(чернослива) or chocolate also 15)______(feel).
